item.title: marcali add a quote by Simon Singh
item.description: "Romantics might like to think of themselves as being composed of stardust. Cynics might prefer to think of themselves as nuclear waste." -- Simon Singh

item.title: marcali add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "It is difficult to get a man to understand something, when his salary depends on his not understanding it." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: marcali add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Doubt not, O poet, but persist. Say 'It is in me, and shall out.' Stand there, balked and dumb, stuttering and stammering, hissed and hooted, stand and strive, until at last rage draw out of thee that dream-power which every night shows thee is thine own; a power transcending all limit and privacy, and by virtue of which a man is the conductor of the whole river of electricity." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: marcali add a quote by Stephen Jay Gould
item.description: "I am, somehow, less interested in the weight and convolutions of Einstein’s brain than in the near certainty that people of equal talent have lived and died in cotton fields and sweatshops." -- Stephen Jay Gould

item.title: marcali add a quote by Lucretius
item.description: "At this stage you must admit that whatever is seen to be sentient is nevertheless composed of atoms that are insentient. The phenomena open to our observation do not contradict this conclusion or conflict with it. Rather they lead us by the hand and compel us to believe that the animate is born, as I maintain, of the insentient" -- Lucretius

item.title: marcali add a quote by Eric Roston
item.description: "Belief that the Earth is only several thousands years old carries a curious implication. The physical evidence for the Earth's age emerged from the same atomic discoveries that later gave the world nuclear weaponry and power plants. The scientific understanding of uranium isotopes that produce the date 4.5 billion years ago is the same understanding of uranium isotopes that led to the production and detonation of nuclear bombs. If scientists do not understand uranium decay well enough to date the Earth, there also cannot be, and can never have been, nuclear weaponry. Certainly a world and a history absent these weapons are desirable, but they are counter-factual. " -- Eric Roston

item.title: marcali add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "Art is what you can get away with." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: marcali add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description:
"Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods."
[Preface to <i>Brissot's Address to His Constituents</i> (1794)]" -- Edmund Burke

item.title: marcali add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Men more frequently require to be reminded than informed." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: marcali add a quote by Richard Rorty
item.description: "Freedom is the recognition of contingency." -- Richard Rorty

item.title: marcali add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "The trouble is that we have a bad habit, encouraged by pendants and sophisticates, of considering happiness as something rather stupid. Only pain is intellectual, only evil interesting. This is the treason of the artist: a refusal to admit the banality of evil and the terrible boredom of pain." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: marcali add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "Let me have my own way in exactly everything and a sunnier and pleasanter creature does not exist." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: marcali add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "The true university of these days is a collection of books.*" -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: marcali add a quote by Laurence J. Peter
item.description: "Some problems are so complex that you have to be highly intelligent and well informed just to be undecided about them." -- Laurence J. Peter

item.title: marcali add a quote by William Morris
item.description: "If you want a golden rule that will fit everything, this is it: Have nothing in your houses that you do not know to be useful or believe to be beautiful." -- William Morris

item.title: marcali add a quote by Ellen Glasgow
item.description: "The only difference between a rut and a grave are the dimensions." -- Ellen Glasgow

item.title: marcali add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: marcali add a quote by John Stuart Mill
item.description: "In this age, the mere example of non-conformity, the mere refusal to bend the knee to custom, is itself a service. Precisely because the tyranny of opinion is such as to make eccentricity a reproach, it is desirable, in order to break through that tyranny, that people should be eccentric. Eccentricity has always abounded when and where strength of character has abounded; and the amount of eccentricity in a society has generally been proportional to the amount of genius, mental vigor, and moral courage which it contained. That so few now dare to be eccentric, marks the chief danger of the time." -- John Stuart Mill

item.title: marcali add a quote by John Andrew Holmes
item.description: "Speech is conveniently located midway between thought and action, where it often substitutes for both." -- John Andrew Holmes

item.title: marcali add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: marcali add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: marcali add a quote by Redd Foxx
item.description: "Health nuts are going to feel stupid someday, lying in hospitals dying of nothing." -- Redd Foxx

item.title: marcali add a quote by Nikola Tesla
item.description: "The scientists of today think deeply instead of clearly. One must be sane to think clearly, but one can think deeply and be quite insane." -- Nikola Tesla

item.title: marcali add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "Some of the worst mistakes in my life were haircuts" -- Jim Morrison

item.title: marcali add a quote by Mick Jagger
item.description: "It's all right letting yourself go, as long as you can get yourself back" -- Mick Jagger

item.title: marcali add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see." -- Mark Twain

item.title: marcali add a quote by Sam Keen
item.description: "We come to love not by finding a perfect person, but by learning to see an imperfect person perfectly." -- Sam Keen

item.title: marcali add a quote by Eve Bearne
item.description: "The problem of brute sanity was identified by George Bernard Shaw when he observed that ‘reformers have the idea that change can be achieved by brute sanity’ … Brute sanity is the tendency to overlook the complexity and detailed processes and procedures required, in favour of the more obvious matters of stressing goals, the importance of the problem and the grand plan. Brute sanity overpromises, overrationalises and consequently results in unfulfilled dreams and frustrations which discourage people from sustaining their efforts and from taking on future change projects." -- Eve Bearne
